testsuite.class: STEP_UTILITYFUNCTIONS - Bash Step Tests For Utility Function
Below test cases are for run state

testcase.class: STEP_UTILITYFUNCTIONS - Bash Step Tests For Utility Function Below test cases are for run state S-Bash-util-6380-001 A user triggers a run where the first step puts an old-format tar run state in the run state containing a directory. A following step is able to restore that directory.
testcase.classclass: S-Bash-util-6380-001 A user triggers a run where the first step puts an old-format tar run state in the run state containing a directory. A following step is able to restore that directory.

testcase.class: STEP_UTILITYFUNCTIONS - Bash Step Tests For Utility Function Below test cases are for run state S-Bash-util-6380-002 A user triggers a run where the first step puts an old-format tar run state in the run state containing a file. A following step is able to restore that file.
testcase.classclass: S-Bash-util-6380-002 A user triggers a run where the first step puts an old-format tar run state in the run state containing a file. A following step is able to restore that file.

testcase.class: STEP_UTILITYFUNCTIONS - Bash Step Tests For Utility Function Below test cases are for run state S-Bash-util-6380-003 A user triggers a run where a step uses add_run_files to add a directory containing a file named run.env to run state. A later step is able to restore that directory and it contains the file.
testcase.classclass: S-Bash-util-6380-003 A user triggers a run where a step uses add_run_files to add a directory containing a file named run.env to run state. A later step is able to restore that directory and it contains the file.

testcase.class: STEP_UTILITYFUNCTIONS - Bash Step Tests For Utility Function Below test cases are for run state S-Bash-util-6380-004 A user triggers a run where a step uses add_run_files to add a file named my_run.env to run state. A later step is able to restore that file.
testcase.classclass: S-Bash-util-6380-004 A user triggers a run where a step uses add_run_files to add a file named my_run.env to run state. A later step is able to restore that file.

testcase.class: STEP_UTILITYFUNCTIONS - Bash Step Tests For Utility Function Below test cases are for run state S-Bash-util-6380-005 A user uses add_run_files to add two directories, containing differently-named files, with the same name. Files from both are included when later restoring the name.
testcase.classclass: S-Bash-util-6380-005 A user uses add_run_files to add two directories, containing differently-named files, with the same name. Files from both are included when later restoring the name.

testcase.class: STEP_UTILITYFUNCTIONS - Bash Step Tests For Utility Function Below test cases are for run state S-Bash-util-6380-006 A user uses restore_run_files to restore the same item from the cache twice. The logs note that it had already been downloaded the second time.
testcase.classclass: S-Bash-util-6380-006 A user uses restore_run_files to restore the same item from the cache twice. The logs note that it had already been downloaded the second time.

testcase.class: STEP_UTILITYFUNCTIONS - Bash Step Tests For Utility Function Below test cases are for run state S-Bash-util-6380-013 A user tries to add too many run variables. The step status is error and there is a message in the logs that the limit was exceeded.
testcase.classclass: S-Bash-util-6380-013 A user tries to add too many run variables. The step status is error and there is a message in the logs that the limit was exceeded.
